definition: lapse/mistake/to make a mistake/fault/service fault (in volleyball, tennis etc)

sentences.english: I was baffled that some ofthe most basic workplace blunders seem to be tripping people up!
sentences.chinese: 许多最基本的职场失误会让他们摔跟头，这让我困惑。

sentences.english: Follow the approach outlined in this article to avoid this pitfall.
sentences.chinese: 通过遵循本文给出的方法可以避免这个失误。

sentences.english: In such a case, a lapse of memory will represent directly the un-invoiced services.
sentences.chinese: 在这种情况下，失误的储存表现为“不”一开单服务。

sentences.english: Music video by Idlewild performing Love Steals Us From Loneliness.
sentences.chinese: 艾德威尔德表演爱音乐视频失误，我们的孤独。

sentences.english: Do you agree and what if they had not failed?
sentences.chinese: 如果你认为他们并没有失误，为什么？

sentences.english: Moments after the gaffe, an apology appeared.
sentences.chinese: 道歉出现在失误后不久。

sentences.english: The first failing, of which Mr Obama in particular is guilty, is misstating the problem.
sentences.chinese: 第一重失误就是谎报病灶，奥巴马难逃其咎。
又一次生物学上的小失误。

sentences.english: Objective To analyze the causes of herniation of brain due to errors of doc tors and nurses.
sentences.chinese: 目的分析脑外科患者脑疝形成过程中的救护失误原因。

sentences.english: I always miss when I have to use a forehand swipe.
sentences.chinese: 每当我正手拍侧击时，总是失误。

sentences.english: Most accidents are blamed on poor maintenance and human error.
sentences.chinese: 大多数事故归咎于很差的维修保养和人为失误。

sentences.english: The most common pitfall in this area is to employ point-to-point service invocation.
sentences.chinese: 在此领域最常见的失误是采用点到点调用。

sentences.english: Gordon was not upset by his failure.
sentences.chinese: 哥顿对他的失误既不惊奇也不生气。

sentences.english: The second section mainly discusses the positioning errors of Song Yu in the 20th century.
sentences.chinese: 第二章，主要论述20世纪宋玉定位的失误。

sentences.english: According to the report, investigators blamed the accident on negligent workers.
sentences.chinese: 据报导，调查人员认为事故原因是工人操作失误所致。

sentences.english: The correlation coefficient between the rates of error and the team ranking is negative.
sentences.chinese: 失误率与名次的相关系数均为负值。

definition: to serve the ball/to tee off
not up to scratch/subpar/off/gone awry/(of an instrument) to be out of kilter/(of a forecast) to be off the mark
to equalize/to level the score/to pull back the advantage
to make a comeback/(of a doctor's assessment of the gender of a fetus) to turn out to be wrong
to break the rules/an illegality/a foul
half of a game or contest/half-court
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
to attack/to assault/to go on the offensive/attack/assault/offense (sports)
